message.content:
cs.IT, cs.DM, cs.DS, cs.CC, cs.LG. 

The paper deals with theoretical bounds and constructions of permutation codes, which are related to information theory (cs.IT) and discrete mathematics (cs.DM). The use of graph theory in improving the Gilbert-Varshamov bound suggests a possible categorization under cs.DS (discrete structures). The proposed encoding scheme based on binary constant weight codes may fall under cs.CC (computational complexity). Finally, the study of different metrics and their applications may also relate to machine learning (cs.LG).
